title: Phantom Ship
opening: General Duessel tells them of the enigmatic Dark Stone. The product of Grado's research into the dark arts, the Dark Stone possesses power far beyond that of the Sacred Stones. According to the rumors swirling about, Vigarde's descent into madness coincides with the creation of the Dark Stone. Ephraim must confirm the existence of the Dark Stone. He decides to travel to Grado by sea. Midway through their passage, however, an eerie fog begins to form...

intro.speaker: Selena
intro.line: Your Majesty... I have returned.

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Selena... You coward. Why did you not execute Duessel?

intro.speaker: Selena
intro.line: Forgive me... It was that Valter...

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Selena. Duessel has betrayed us. He has bent his knee to Ephraim. Are you a traitor, too?

intro.speaker: Selena
intro.line: Never! I am Your Majesty's vassal. I am yours, body and soul. Your Majesty, please, another chance, I beg you! Any order you see fit to issue, I will complete!

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: .......Selena. I have something for you. If I may, Father?

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Yes.

intro.speaker: Selena
intro.line: What is it, Prince Lyon?

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: I want you to go to Za'albul Marsh and retrieve something for me. It is a dragonstone, a very special kind of rock.

intro.speaker: Selena
intro.line: A dragonstone?

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: That's right. It's very rare. There are only two in the entire world. I've heard rumors of a collector there who has one for sale. It looks like nothing but a common gemstone. I need it for my research. If I have that stone....my... Urg...gaa...

intro.speaker: Selena
intro.line: My prince, are you all right?

intro.speaker: Lyon
intro.line: I'm fine. Don't worry about me. Now, please, find me the dragonstone. Will you approve my request, Father?

intro.speaker: Vigarde
intro.line: Yes. Do as my son asks.

intro.speaker: Selena
intro.line: Yes, understood. Your Majesty, I...would like to renew my oath of service to you here today. I pledge that I shall never again falter in my duty to you or to Grado. I beg your leave, my lord.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Is this the first time you've seen the ocean, Myrrh?

intro.speaker: Myrrh
intro.line: Yes. It's so blue, so vast.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: It is at that. You know, this is my first passage on a ship. I've never appreciated just how enormous the sea is.

intro.speaker: Myrrh
intro.line: Really? I'd never have guessed you hadn't sailed before. You seem so calm.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: If I'm to lead us, I can't allow any weakness to show through. I must appear competent and capable at all times, you understand?

intro.speaker: Myrrh
intro.line: Ephraim... Um...
Prince Ephraim.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Excuse me, Myrrh. We'll have to continue this later.

intro.speaker: Myrrh
intro.line: Ah, all right.

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: What is it, Seth?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: There's a ship following us, just on the edge of the fog. Should I ready the company for battle?

intro.speaker: Ephraim
intro.line: Is it a Grado vessel?

intro.speaker: Seth
intro.line: It's hard to say. The fog makes it difficult to see clearly. However, her crew seems not to be...human.

intro.speaker: Riev
intro.line: Heh heh heh... Rise and rage, my precious children of darkness. Ruin the wood and ride the sea! Drown your foes, and devour their flesh! Come celebrate the glorious rebirth of your lord and master, the Demon King! Heh, heh, heh.

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: There! The enemy is closing. Prepare for battle!

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: They've pulled alongside us... Those creatures are trying to board! That's fine--it'll bring 'em within reach of my lance. Push them back! Board their ship and seize the blasted thing!

battle.speaker: Ephraim
battle.line: Another ship!? Stay calm, everyone! We take the fight to them!

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: Friends of justice! Allies of righteousness and order! Know that I, L’Arachel, have arrived! Now, I shall purge the seas of this vile vessel of villainy!

battle.speaker: Dozla
battle.line: Gwah ha ha! Nice alliteration, Princess L’Arachel!

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: ...... Hm? I didn’t hear Rennac’s voice. How very odd. Dozla, where has Rennac run off to this time?

battle.speaker: Dozla
battle.line: Hmmm... He was with us at mealtime before we boarded, but...

battle.speaker: L’Arachel
battle.line: That man can be such a distraction. ...Oh well, never mind! Let’s get started destroying these agents of chaos!

battle.speaker: Dozla
battle.line: Gwah ha ha! Leave it to me!

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: Fear not, O weary traveler, for I am here to save you! I grant you the favor of my divine aid.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: Who are you? What are you doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: Ah! Can it be? Do you not know the tales of my deeds? Have you not heard of the beauteous young woman traveling to defeat evil?

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: It’s nothing... Please pay me no mind. I just feel a bit like being alone and weeping for a while.

recruit-talk.speaker: Ephraim
recruit-talk.line: What? No, you can’t... This is no place for crying. I’m sure you’ve noticed, but we’re under attack by monsters. If you can do anything to help, we would appreciate it.

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: That’s a good idea! I’ll do it. Now, I want you to observe closely my graceful actions!

recruit-talk.speaker: Dozla
recruit-talk.line: Yes? What is it, Princess L’Arachel?

recruit-talk.speaker: L’Arachel
recruit-talk.line: We’re going to be working together with those people. I want you to stay close by. Are you ready?

recruit-talk.speaker: Dozla
recruit-talk.line: Gwah ha ha! Ready as always!

end.speaker: Seth
end.line: We've destroyed the remaining monsters. The ship appears to be empty.

end.speaker: L'Arachel
end.line: And once again, the forces of righteousness prevail!

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Thank you. We owe our victory to you.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Don't mention it. My name is L'Arachel. I'm on a never-ending quest to defeat evil in the name of virtue and order. Wait... Your face has a certain familiarity. I recently met a young woman who greatly resembles you.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Do you mean, Eirika? She's my sister.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Eirika? Isn't that the name of the princess of Renais? And you have a very regal air about you yourself, don't you?

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: My name is Ephraim, Prince of Renais. We're fighting to end Grado's invasion. To be honest...

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Oh my! In that case, I must accompany you.

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: Do you understand that we alone are facing all the armies of Grado? We face untold numbers, and our odds of success are embarrassingly small.

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: You clearly do not know who I am. Do not be startled by what I'm about to disclose to you... I am the princess of Rausten, theocracy of the righteous!

end.speaker: Ephraim
end.line: You're the princess of Rausten? Hm. You certainly don't have the bearing of a commoner, but...

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Ah, of course. My natural nobility gives me away every time. Truth to tell, dire circumstances have led me to begin this journey in secret. Prince Ephraim of Renais, please by assured that Rausten is your ally. Let us stand together against the villainous Grado Empire!

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: ...Well, that's that, Dozla. We will now be traveling with Ephraim and his companions.

end.speaker: Dozla
end.line: Gwah ha ha! Understood! For you, Princess L'Arachel, I would dive headlong into a sea of evil! Why, I'd even tie myself up with ropes and chains first!

end.speaker: L’Arachel
end.line: Such fabulous devotion! You are truly my most loyal attendant. Let us be off then.
